revised_title: Peculiarities in the Physical Properties of Iron-Aluminum Alloys
tldr: This article investigates the physical properties of iron-aluminum alloys, focusing on their thermal expansion and electrical resistivity. The authors discovered that certain alloys with an aluminum content of over 12% exhibit peculiarities in these properties, which they attribute to a phase transformation. They also found that heat treatment can modify the properties of these alloys, with the effect being most pronounced between 13% and 14% aluminum content.
